intro: Chonemorpha vestita, commonly known as the naked chonemorpha, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. Chonemorpha vestita is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
